pull.title: rpc: trigger error before dealing strSecret / strLabel
pull.body:
Improvement on importprivkey method.
Errors can be triggered early.

verification.payload:
tree e613f69524b50ff945a6449832fa39a37d091c1c
parent 1488f55fa57a1400a57be837b574183f019c7855
author Benjamin DESCAMPS <benjamin.descamps@paymium.com> 1627241369 +0200
committer Benjamin DESCAMPS <benjamin.descamps@paymium.com> 1627241369 +0200

trigger error before dealing strSecret / strLabel

events.message: trigger error before dealing strSecret / strLabel

events.body: For me. It's very difficult to understand clearly.
I think it's better to deal directly exit function. Here we can trigger two JSONRPCError, without instantiate string for strLabel & strSecret
What does this change from a user perspective?
At this time nothing, but it can prevent future bug.

A bug create by a bad interpretation of code
Here we create 2 variables strSecret StrLabel.
 - strSecret which is instanciate by a request params
 - strLabel which is instanciate by an empty string and set after by a request params (if it is present)

There is no reason to dealing them now because we don't use them.  Moreover if the wallet rescan is disabled or if the wallet is currently rescanning we have creating all that for nothing

This code doesn't get called very much (people only use it to manually type in their legacy private keys) and the performance doesn't really matter. It would save us from copying a string _each time an error happens_...

The initializations could also be moved up before `LOCK(pwallet->cs_wallet);` to save on lock time.
The initialization of `strLabel` could be moved down further also, to line 168.

:bike: :bike: :bike:

With argument parsing moving to RPCHelpMan, this will become obsolete. So tend to NACK on this diff.

Maybe it could make sense to use the zeroing-on-destruction string here.
As it stands, this doesn't seem worth the hassle, so closing this.

issue.title: Compiling fails on 32-bit systems
issue.body:
Since #20233 compiling with clang 10.0 fails:
```
bench/addrman.cpp:113:32: error: non-constant-expression cannot be narrowed from type 'unsigned long long' to 'size_t' (aka 'unsigned int') in initializer list [-Wc++11-narrowing]
    const size_t addrman_count{bench.epochs() * bench.epochIterations()};
                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
bench/addrman.cpp:113:32: note: insert an explicit cast to silence this issue
    const size_t addrman_count{bench.epochs() * bench.epochIterations()};
                               ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
                               static_cast<size_t>(                    )
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [Makefile:12508: bench/bench_bitcoin-addrman.o] Error 1
```
